required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Trial of SL1904B CAR-T Cells for Relapsed or Refractory Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Trial of SL1904B CAR-T Cells for Relapsed or Refractory Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma

brief_summary.textblock: This is a study of patients with relapsed or refractory non-Hodgkin's lymphoma. To evaluate the safety and efficacy of SL1904B in patients with relapsed or refractory non-Hodgkin's lymphoma.

detailed_description.textblock:
The CARs consist of an anti-CD19 single-chain variable fragment（scFv） that was derived from the FMC63 mouse hybridoma, a portion of the human CD137（4-1BB） molecule, and the intracellular component of the human CD3ζ molecule. Prior to CAR-T cell infusion, the patients will be subjected to preconditioning treatment. After CAR-T cell infusion, the patients will be evaluated for adverse reactions and efficacy.
The Main research objectives:
To evaluate the safety and efficacy of SL1904B in patients with recurrent or refractory non-Hodgkin's lymphoma
The Secondary research objectives:
To investigate the cytokinetic characteristics of SL1904B in patients with recurrent or refractory non-Hodgkin's lymphoma.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety: Incidence and severity of adverse events
primary_outcome.time_frame: First month post CAR-T cells infusion
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate the possible adverse events occurred within first one month after SL1904B infusion, including the incidence and severity of symptoms such as cytokine release syndrome and neurotoxicity
Overall Remission Rate (ORR) including partial remission and complete remission rate after infusion of SL1904B

secondary_outcome.description: the copy number of CD19 CAR- T cells in the genomes of PBMC by qPCR method and percentage of CD19 CAR- T cells measured by flow cytometry method

secondary_outcome.time_frame: First month post CAR-T cells infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Cytokine( IL-6,IL-10,IFN-γ,TNF-α ) concentration (pg/mL) by flow cytometry method

arm_group.description: Patients will be treated with CD19 CAR-T cells

intervention.description: Biological: CD19 CAR-T; Drug: Cyclophosphamide,Fludarabine; Procedure: Leukapheresis;
